data.title: Problem with embedding C# syntax between delimiters
data.body:
Hello.

I am writting a simple language extension to provide syntax highlighting for our custom DSL platform in VSCode. I am trying to embed C# highlighting in between single quotes (') and SQL in between double quotes. The problem is with C# highlighting. It seems that VSCode doesn't recognize ending single quote, and keeps the rest of the file in C# highlighting mode. Source of the extension project is on https://github.com/Hugibeer/RhetosDSL with sample test file to show the behavior.
I am not really sure if this is bug in VSCode, maybe C# support for VSCode is treating ending single quote as a start of the character definition, or is this a question of which extension "came first" to evaluate the single quote. I think it is because Sublime Text doesn't have this issue :) If I am doing something wrong, please help me correct this.

- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Download code
2. Open Rhetos.vscode folder and start the extensions
3. Open file Samples\SampleTest.rhe to see that ShortString is not recognizd as keyword.

Thank you

data.title: Files on OneDrive will not open.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
(Please note this is on a very recent Insider build 16179, which may or may not be a factor).

Code cannot open files from my OneDrive directory.

Trying to open a file through the "Open File" menu item shows the following error:
```
Path does not exist
The path 'C:\Users\<user>\OneDrive\Documents\<file>.txt' does not seem to exist anymore on disk.
```
Opening the file from the Windows shell by right clicking and selecting "Open with Code" shows only an empty file.

This happens to all files in my OneDrive folder. Opening from another application works OK (for example Notepad).


- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.2 (6eaebe3b9c70406d67c97779468c324a7a95db0e, 2017-04-13T08:03:11.395Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.16179
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|xml|DotJoshJohnson|1.7.0|
|CppSnippets|hars|0.0.7|
|spacegray-vscode|ionutvmi|1.2.0|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.10.5|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.8.1|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.12.2|
|material-icon-theme|PKief|2.0.4|
|Ruby|rebornix|0.10.4|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  From Code, select "Open File" and attempt to open a file from the OneDrive folder. Alternatively, attempt to open from the shell through right-click and "Open with Code"
2. Receive error that Path does not exist, or an empty file is shown.

data.title: Relax quickfix action to select any problem marker on the current line
data.body:
This is something I'm used to from Eclipse. When you invoke a quickfix, and your carret/cursor is not currently inside a problem marker, then Eclipse looks inside the whole line for problem markers and uses those to determine the applicable quickfixes.

It would be nice if vscode could do the same. I find it slightly annoying to have to navigate my cursor into the exact position of the quickfix before hitting the `CTRL+.` shortcut. Kind of defeats the purpose of the *quick* fix. Cursoring around slows things down too much.

Together with [this](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/13631) that would really help to make the quickfixes a real productivity booster (Just hit `CTRL+.` and then immediately `ENTER` ).

Afterthought: We could even extend this idea a little further and look for 'markers that are not far away' when there are also no markers on the current line. Not far away could mean the line above / below, or even just find the closest marker in the file, no matter how far away it is.

data.title: Display of frames without 'source' has regressed in more recent versions of VS Code
data.body:
VS Code version: v1.11.2

## Steps to reproduce
1. Open attached folder with VSCode.
[hwapp.zip](https://github.com/OmniSharp/omnisharp-vscode/files/946119/hwapp.zip)
2. Press F5 to start to debug.
3. Press Pause button.

## Expected  behavior
The frame with source should be automatically selected. Frames without source should be greyed out like they once were:
![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20922638/25264765/b1e306be-269b-11e7-9248-9db430ef4392.PNG)

## Actual behavior
The top frame is selected even though it doesn't have source and an 'Unknown Source' element is added
![capturesss](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20922638/25264794/d907dee0-269b-11e7-99f0-68b75ff8fa47.PNG)

## Notes
The formatting issue alone isn't that big of a deal, but I figured I would bring it up. The frame selection problem is much more of a deal, but it is already covered by https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/25104. So feel free to dupe this if you don't want a separate issue.

Example json response to the `stackTrace` command:

```json
{
    "seq":29,
    "type":"response",
    "request_seq":11,
    "success":true,
    "command":"stackTrace",
    "message":"",
    "body":{
        "stackFrames": [
            {"id":1000,"name":"[External Code]","line":0,"column":0},
            {
                "id":1001,
                "name":"clicon.dll!Program.Main(string[] args) Line 14",
                "source": {
                    "name":"Program.cs",
                    "path":"d:\\proj\\clicon\\Program.cs",
                    "sourceReference":0,
                    "checksums":[{"algorithm":"SHA1","checksum":"7241f6d2a81d39115752953170fa4e9391d5fcf0"}]
                },
                "line":14,
                "column":9,
                "endLine":14,
                "endColumn":33,
                "moduleId":"{7C382E61-E5C4-49EC-A609-69A65BF4E458}"
            },
            {"id":1002,"name":"[External Code]","line":0,"column":0}
        ],
        "totalFrames":3
    }
}
```

data.title: Switch Window
data.body:
- Should have a keyboard shortcut (e.g., Ctrl + Shift + R).
- Use the same labels as Open Recent (Ctrl + R) to not be confusing.
- Show entries in MRU order.
- Support cycling through by holding modifiers while pressing the main key repeatedly.

data.title: Duplicate lines at end of file on save
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

*Software Versions*
- VSCode Version: 11.1.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro Version 1703

*Extensions* 
- Angular v4 Typescript Snippets - 2.2.3
- Auto Rename Tag - 0.0.11
- C# - 1.8.1
- Contextual Duplicate - 0.2.0
- Intellisense for CSS Class Names - 1.1.0
- JS-CSS-HTML Formatter - 0.2.3

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Save a file that you are working on.
2. Sometimes it randomly adds duplicate lines to the end of the file with the same line number.  Appears to only be a visual bug, you cannot select the lines that are added or do anything with them.

data.title: Feature Request - Add GUI for installation of previous extension versions
data.body:
Occasionally, an extension update will cause breakage that seriously impairs its usage, and the fix could take days (or worse) to materialize. One can manually download the old VSIX asset and reinstall it that way if one knows where to look, but it's pretty tedious and not really documented anywhere (I found it on Stack Overflow).

It would be great if the extension's page had a tab with previous versions as install links, or some other interface for choosing a particular version.

data.title: Unable to perform go build
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: 1703 15063.138

Steps to Reproduce:

1) Get a VM image for win10 15.15063 from [modern.ie](https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-edge/tools/vms/)

2) start it up, install updates, restart

3) install vs code with defaults

4) install [go runtime ](https://golang.org/dl/) with defaults

5) start vs code

6) install go extension, restart vs code

7) create a new .go file:

~~~
package main
import "fmt"
func main() {
	fmt.Println("foobar")
}
~~~

8) ctrl+f5

Expected output: `foobar` printed

Actual output: 

~~~
The program "${file}" does not exist: Error: ENOENT: no such file or directory, lstat 'C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code\${file}'
~~~

On the top the following appears:

~~~
Error: Failed to continue: "The program attribute must point to valid directory, .go file or executable."
~~~

Which you can either "close" or "open launch.json" but if you try the latter, nothing happens at all.

data.title: Auto import quickfix is not shown if the symbol name of the export is already used in a file
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: Windows 7
- TypeScript Version: 2.2.2

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Declare some test data in a file.
```ts
// in test-data.ts
export const states = ['CA', 'MD', 'OH', 'VA'];
```

2. Assign the exported symbol(s) to a new variable in a different file. Reuse the name of the export for the new variable.
```ts
// in registration-form.ts
// try to assign states from test-data to a new constant.
// notice the missing import.
const states = states;
```

Expected behavior:
VS Code should offer a quick fix for the missing import.
> Import states from "test-data"

Actual behavior:
No quick fix is shown. Presumably because the name of the export is already used in the file that contains the missing import.

data.title: Can't --inspect into a remote node container (port translation not working)
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: insider
- OS Version: Windows 10 + docker

This issue is related to the previews one, albeit this time the translation issue is with port number.
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/23257

Now IP translation works as VSCode is respecting the launch.json IP.
However the same problem was not resolved for port translation.

That is, VSCode seems to ignore the port I specify in launch.json

Example [Host port -> Container port]
9999 -> --inspect-brk=0.0.0.0:9229
The above work when I open it in chrome as 172.17.0.1:9999 but it doesn't in VSCode if I specify the port number in launch.json as 9999 

Google Chrome handles both flawlessly.

I am using react and redux in my project. i don't know what more information is needed so please tell if there are anything.

Add the ability to select encoding when searching in files.

files.autoGuessEncoding is a great feature, but the search only works in one encoding

data.title: Slow auto complete speed for custom modules python
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.2 
- OS Version: mac 10.12.4

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install "Python" extension 
2. Create virtualenv and launch vs code from terminal when virtualenv is activated
3. Create settings.json to specify path to python executable 

```
{
    "python.pythonPath": "${workspaceRoot}/venv/bin/python",
    "python.autoComplete.extraPaths": [
        "${workspaceRoot}/venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages"
    ]
}

```

Autocomplete for custom python modules (e.g. numpy) has a 2 seconds delay. But autocomplete for native modules is speedy. 

Is there a indexing option I can set to speed up the auto complete of custom modules ?

data.title: Editor's code collapse does not work with upper code already collapsed
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12
- OS Version: Win 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create new XML file with the following content:
```
<?xml version= "1.0" encoding= "utf-8" ?>
<root>
	<test>
	<nested>
		Hello world!
	</nested>
	<nested>
		Hello world!
	</nested>
	</test>
</root>
```
2. Collapse first `<nested/>` node
3. Try collapsing second `<nested/>` node.
-> Fails to collapse it.

![expanding](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2239563/25267120/eef2727e-2673-11e7-9b7f-2c03dced0887.gif)
